This code chunk is part of a method within a Python class that extends `Pmw.ApplicationShell`, specifically for creating an `OptionMenu` widget using the Pmw (Python Mega Widgets) library. The context involves initializing, configuring, and packing the `OptionMenu`, setting its command callback, binding help text, and recording both the widget and associated variable in a structured manner within the application shell framework.

# Create widget
        widget = Pmw.OptionMenu(parent, **kw)
        # Do this after so command isn't called on widget creation
        widget['command'] = command
        # Pack widget
        widget.pack(side = side, fill = fill, expand = expand)
        # Bind help
        self.bind(widget.component('menubutton'), help)
        # Record widget and variable
        self.addWidget(category, text, widget)
        self.addVariable(category, text, variable)
        return widget
